about.summary: Provides an interface to access public economic and financial data for economic research and quantitative analysis. The data sources including NBS, FRED, 163, Sina, Eastmoney and etc. It also provides quantitative functions for trading strategies based on the 'data.table', 'TTR', 'PerformanceAnalytics' and etc packages.

Provides an interface to access public economic and financial data for economic research and quantitative analysis. The data sources including NBS, FRED, 163, Sina, Eastmoney and etc. It also provides quantitative functions for trading strategies based on the 'data.table', 'TTR', 'PerformanceAnalytics' and etc packages.

name: r-pedquant
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.2.5" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-pedquant
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/pedquant_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/pedquant/pedquant_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: dc6405b4a150d8def674dce17ee821e997c2b64cc5a5f4850bfc4b49ff4eab67

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-performanceanalytics
    - r-ttr
    - r-curl
    - r-data.table
    - r-echarts4r
    - r-httr
    - r-jsonlite
    - r-lubridate
    - r-readr
    - r-readxl
    - r-rvest
    - r-stringi
    - r-xefun
    - r-zoo
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-performanceanalytics
    - r-ttr
    - r-curl
    - r-data.table
    - r-echarts4r
    - r-httr
    - r-jsonlite
    - r-lubridate
    - r-readr
    - r-readxl
    - r-rvest
    - r-stringi
    - r-xefun
    - r-zoo

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('pedquant')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('pedquant')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/ShichenXie/pedquant
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: Provides an interface to access public economic and financial data for economic research and quantitative analysis. The data sources including NBS, FRED, 163, Sina, Eastmoney and etc. It also provides quantitative functions for trading strategies based on the 'data.table', 'TTR', 'PerformanceAnalytics' and etc
    packages.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - l2dy

# Package: pedquant
# Version: 0.2.1
# Title: Public Economic Data and Quantitative Analysis
# Description: Provides an interface to access public economic and financial data for economic research and quantitative analysis. The data sources including NBS, FRED, 163, Sina, Eastmoney and etc. It also provides quantitative functions for trading strategies based on the 'data.table', 'TTR', 'PerformanceAnalytics' and etc packages.
# Authors@R: person("Shichen", "Xie", email = "xie@shichen.name", role = c("aut", "cre"))
# Depends: R (>= 4.1.0)
# Imports: data.table, TTR, zoo, PerformanceAnalytics, curl, httr, rvest, lubridate, stringi, jsonlite, readxl, readr, echarts4r, xefun
# Suggests: knitr, rmarkdown
# License: GPL-3
# URL: https://github.com/ShichenXie/pedquant
# BugReports: https://github.com/ShichenXie/pedquant/issues
# LazyData: true
# RoxygenNote: 7.2.1
# Encoding: UTF-8
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2022-11-12 09:50:56 UTC; shichenxie
# Author: Shichen Xie [aut, cre]
# Maintainer: Shichen Xie <xie@shichen.name>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2022-11-12 10:20:02 UTC
